description: The 8,000 square-foot Spa InterContinental, offers an essential blend of spa services to refresh your body and mind. Located on the third floor of the InterContinental(R) Toronto Centre Hotel, the spa specializes in massage, body therapy, skin care and aesthetic services.

reviews.title: Lovely
text: I visited last year just before lockdown began and it was a really nice place . I was on a work trip .

reviews.title: Great staff
text: I really enjoyed this spa place. It was very relaxing and the service was really good too. I'll for sure recommend this place.

reviews.title: Perfect reward after a looking bike trip.
text: We had booked massages to celebrate the end of a 200km bike trip (Kitchener, Galt, Paris, Brantford, Hamilton, Burlington, Oakville, Toronto). It was easy to get to via bike, and we had a place to park or bikes. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Kenneth was our RMT, and he was phenomenal. He understood completely which muscles needed attention, and expertly avoided the road rash on my leg. The pool and amenities were excellent. I would highly recommend a spa visit here.

reviews.title: Good service, bad ambiance
text: My husband and I came here for a couples massage and the whole experience left us disappointed.  The massages themselves were great, so no issue there.  However, it REALLY falls short of being a relaxing day spa.  You obviously pay a premium (vs. just visiting a regular MT at their office) because of the facilities, and they were pretty bad.  As I now see in reviews, the hot tub and pool are shared with the hotel- kids splashing don't exactly make for a zen experience.  The steam rooms were located in the change rooms, so we couldn't go together.  The space is very dated, bad patchwork to holes in the walls, washroom elements falling apart.  After our massages, we basically spent 10 minutes in hot tub and then left since it was the opposite of what we were looking/hoping for.

reviews.title: Lovely treatments with great stagf
text: We had a couple massage and pedicures on our afternoon of pampering.  We were welcomed into their inviting area by the pleasant front desk staff.  We were show to the change room were we were provided with a locker with a robe, towel and slippers.  We had time for a swim, jacuzzi and steam bath before our massage.  The waiting area had orange and lemon water, tea and fresh fruit.  The massage table was very comfortable and both RMT’s gave great massages.  We left feeling relaxed and rejuvenated.  Next we had pedicures.  The room was nice with two massaging chairs.  They ended with a lovely salt scrub on feet and lower legs and then a foot massage.  Afterward we sat outside on the deck and enjoyed wine and a cheese plate.
Very pleasant afternoon.

reviews.title: Fantastic Couples Massage
text: We had a little downtime during a weekend business conference and tried the couples massage midday on Friday. The 50 minute massage was certainly a deep tissue massage, but the plate of fresh fruit and cheese afterwards, with fruit infused water was a nice and unexpected touch. We then followed that up with a steam and it was perfect.

reviews.title: Super relaxing!
text: Services are amazing! If you want to take some time off to relax yourself, this is definitely a place to go!

reviews.title: Professional staffs.
text: The staffs are very friendly and accommodating. We loved the way they treat their customers. The quality of their service is excellent too.

reviews.title: Relaxing spa day
text: I had an amazing massage here, the masseur was very attentive and thorough. I also had a great facial here and spent the day relaxing in the pool and hot tub. Valentines day well spent!

reviews.title: A Spa Delight in Downtown Toronto
text: My friend and I had the pleasure of visiting and enjoying a few hours at the hotel spa this past weekend. I love spas and always have a hard time finding a place that is affordable and that staff actually enjoy their work. Good news is that I enjoyed the Intercontinental Spa and was more than satisfied with the service and staff. Here are the details. When we arrived, we were welcomed and directed to the locker room area where we were given robes and slippers (good quality robes and slippers..which one believes should be the norm in all spas, but you'd be surprise how this is not a standard for many places). We were then escorted to the spa area where we were offered lemon water and filled out the normal paper-work. My masseuse was named Kobi and he was just fantastic! Very knowledgeable, respectful, engageing, and best of all gave me an awesome massage! He focused on my areas of need and he even took the time to explain exercises that I should do to minimize the stress and knots that accumulate on my upper back. Who does that? I've been to countless spas in Toronto and very few people actually take the time to recommend exercises and poses to help minimize stress. This information was all given after the massage was already done and I was ready to leave the massage room. In most spas you're basically given a massage and once they are done, the masseuse walks out of the room and you don't see them anymore. Kobi stayed outside the door and  took me back to the front area to drink some tea and enjoy some time in the pool, jacuzzi, and also the steam room. These are the perks of getting a treatment at this spa, you're able to hang out and stay to enjoy the other hotel facilities. Most spas downtown don't have these perks and for the price of the massage, which includes using all spa hotel facilities, I found this to be a great investment. When you go to the Intercontinental Spa you feel like you actually enjoyed a few hours of total relaxation and pampering, without having to leave the city. You leave this place feeling energized, stress-free, and full of positive vibes. By the way, for $25 dollars anyone can enter the spa area and enjoy the pool, jacuzzi, steam room and deck area.

reviews.title: The jacuzzi is perfect
text: Patio only accessible for abonnements
Swimming pool is big and the jacuzzi is above all expectations ! Very hot and spacious.
The place is clean and they have a lot of towels

reviews.title: A relaxing experience while your partner is taking a course!
text: Nothing better than a mani, pedi, and an hour of working out the kinks at this premium spa. The staff and area are very welcoming.

reviews.title: Fell a little short
text: Traveling: 6 women, early 30s, for a birthday.
We chose to book MULTIPLE treatments at the Spa Intercontinental because of the facilities listed.
Everyone walked away having felt great about their actual Spa treatments -- between the six of us we had multiple facials, massages and nail services.
However, a few things left us feeling disenchanted:

- We were constantly told one thing and having another happen (when I pre booked a $300 package I was told a pedi was included but when I arrived they had a mani put in and told me it would be an additional $70 for the pedi / We ordered off the room service menu to the Spa and were told there'd be one "delivery" charge ... we were charged two, tipped only to realize gratuity was included.)

- We were told of the Spa facilities -- pool, hottub, sauna ... what we were not told is that the pool and hottub are SHARED with the hotel ... so while we were trying to have a relaxing day, there were children floating about.
The hotel/Spa did send us complimentary cheese plates and desserts as we were celebrating two birthdays, so that was appreciated. Robes and footwear and lockers were provided.
The rosemary mint shampoo and conditioner in the showers absolutely dried out all of our hair. That was a disappointment.
Overall, the day was relaxing and enjoyable but for a few hiccups. Prices are reasonable Spa prices, but I had higher expectations for the facility itself.

reviews.title: Very nice spa.
text: We had lunch before our treatments, went swimming in the indoor pool and whirlpool.  I had a body treatment, facial and sticks and stones massage.  I can't say enough nice things about the therapists, they were so wonderful and caring.

reviews.title: Great day with my sister
text: My sister and I had a fabulous and relaxing day at this spa. The massage was customized for my individual issues and I was impressed with Robert the RMT's knowledge and professionalism.

I also got a sea salt body scrub that could've been super messy and awkward if not for the very competent aesthetician I had. Every time I needed something, be it a new towel or my slippers, she was right there with it before I even had to ask. Her kindness and professionalism made me feel 100% relaxed and pampered, and the treatment made my skin unbelievably smooth.

The facility itself is large, bright, and beautiful. You can sip your tea and look directly up at the CN tower through the glass roof. They didn't rush us out at all, and it was great to chat and relax with my sister after our individual treatments. We enjoyed the hot tub and saltwater pool, and of course the Aveda products in the showers too! We will be back to this spa, for sure.

reviews.title: Disappointed
text: Had a spa mani/pedi done.  Loved the Aveda products used.  Less than impressed with the actual shaping and polish job done.  Polish didn't even last 24 hours.  Certainly not worth the price!

reviews.title: Not a 5 star hotel spa
text: My other half and I enjoyed a massage at this spa for a quick city escape.  The spa is in need of some updating as it has not kept up with many of the new hotels in the city.  The massage was great but the rooms were small, cold and music was weird.  A good update and this spa could easily compete with the other hotels in the city.

reviews.title: Fabulous hotel
text: huge room,. I Love the salt water pool and the salt water hot tub! Salt water means that there is very little chlorine used and none of that awful smell or burning eyes. There is also a fabulous steam room in the locker room. Fantastic location.

reviews.title: I floated out of there!
text: Wonderful facial - will be back for more!!! Leslie knew exactly which products my skin type required and the pressure points for the massage.

reviews.title: Fantastic facial
text: The elemental facial I recieved from Leslie at The Spa was fantastic! A quiet professional, her firm but gentle technique left my skin feeling hydrated and refreshed and I really appreciated her tailored application of Aveda products.
